org.fluidity.foundation

Class IOStreams

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fluidity.foundation.Utility
      • org.fluidity.foundation.IOStreams

  • public final class IOStreams
extends Utility
    General I/O stream related convenience methods.

      static interface  IOStreams.Output
      Byte array sink.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public static InputStream send(InputStream input,
                               byte[] buffer,
                               IOStreams.Output output)
                        throws IOException
        Sends the contents of input stream to the consumer. Neither stream will be closed; use the try-with-resource construct to close them automatically.
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream to copy data from.
        buffer - the buffer to use.
        output - the consumer to send data to; the data is sent in the specified buffer, and the consumer receives the number of content bytes in that buffer.
        Returns:
        the input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when reading fails.

      • pipe

        public static <T extends OutputStream> T pipe(InputStream input,
                                              T output,
                                              byte[] buffer)
                                       throws IOException
        Fully copies the contents of one stream into another. Neither stream will be closed; use the try-with-resource construct to close them automatically.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the received and returned output stream.
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream to copy data from.
        output - the output stream to copy data to.
        buffer - the buffer to use.
        Returns:
        the output stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when reading or writing fails.

      • load

        public static byte[] load(InputStream stream,
                          byte[] buffer)
                   throws IOException
        Reads into a byte array all content from the given stream. The stream will not be closed; use the try-with-resource construct to close it automatically.
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream to load the contents of; may not be null.
        buffer - the buffer to use; may not be null.
        Returns:
        the contents of the given stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when reading fails.

      • load

        public static String load(InputStream stream,
                          Charset charset,
                          byte[] buffer)
                   throws IOException
        Reads into a text string all content from the given stream. The stream will not be closed; use the try-with-resource construct to close it automatically.
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream to load the contents of; may not be null.
        charset - the character set of the stream; may not be null.
        buffer - the buffer to use; may not be null.
        Returns:
        the contents of the given stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when reading fails.

      • store

        public static OutputStream store(OutputStream stream,
                                 byte[] data,
                                 byte[] buffer)
                          throws IOException
        Writes the given data to the given stream. The stream will not be closed; use the try-with-resource construct to close it automatically.
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream to save to; may not be null.
        data - the contents to save; may not be null.
        buffer - the buffer to use; may not be null.
        Returns:
        the output stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when writing fails.

      • store

        public static OutputStream store(OutputStream stream,
                                 String text,
                                 Charset charset,
                                 byte[] buffer)
                          throws IOException
        Writes the given text to the given stream. The stream will not be closed; use the try-with-resource construct to close it automatically.
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream to save to; may not be null.
        text - the contents to save; may not be null.
        charset - the character set of the text; may not be null.
        buffer - the buffer to use; may not be null.
        Returns:
        the output stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when writing fails.
